intro: Sticherus nigropaleaceus, commonly known as the blackish pale leaf sticherus, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dark green to blackish-green foliage, which is often covered with a thin layer of whitish or pale-colored powder. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rock crevices. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and tend to be more or less appressed when dry. Sticherus nigropaleaceus is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions.
